0.cdata!:
Mexico - Proyecto de Desarrollo de Areas
            de Temporal

abstracts.cdata!:
The Rainfed Areas Development Project
            will raise agricultural production in selected rainfed
            areas. This will be done through: (a) investing in
            small-scale irrigation and other productive investments; (b)
            transferring both new and existing agricultural technologies
            through private sector extension; (c) reducing costs of soil
            erosion; and (d) strengthening the capacity of the executing
            agency. The project is targeted at small farmers in the ten
            states, chiefly in semiarid and temperate zones, with
            rainfall less than 1,000 mm annually and where moisture
            deficit is the main constraint to productivity. The
            operation will have three components: (a) rural investment;
            (b) agricultural technology transfer; and (c) institutional
            development and training.
